content.content: 8. (1) A borrower to whom a student loan has been made before August 1, 2001, after ceasing to be both a student for the purposes of this Regulation and an Ontario Learn and Stay Grant student and on or before the last day of the sixth month after the month in which the borrower ceases to be both a student for the purposes of this Regulation and an Ontario Learn and Stay Grant student, shall enter into a loan agreement to be known as a consolidated student loan agreement in a form determined by the Minister with the bank to which their obligations under the student loan are owed, which agreement shall determine the amount and duration of the repayments to be made to discharge the principal amount of the student loan and interest on the outstanding balance from time to time. O. Reg. 84/23, s. 2. (2) Where a borrower has entered into a consolidated student loan agreement under subsection (1), and again becomes a student for the purposes of this Regulation or an Ontario Learn and Stay Grant student whose obligations under the consolidated student loan agreement are suspended by the bank, when they again cease to be both a student for the purposes of this Regulation and an Ontario Learn and Stay Grant student and on or before the last day of the sixth month after the month in which the borrower ceases to be both a student for the purposes of this Regulation and an Ontario Learn and Stay Grant student, they shall enter into a new consolidated student loan agreement with the bank to which their obligations under the student loan are owed, in place of the former consolidated student loan agreement which agreement shall determine the amount and duration of the payments to be made to discharge the principal amount of the loan and interest on the outstanding balance from time to time.
